Users who are identified as avid viewers of drama television shows, such as CSI: Miami, The Sopranos, 24, and Law and Order: SVU. Advertisers looking to reach this segment should consider airing commercials during these shows and on online streaming websites where these shows are featured.

Users who are identified as likely fans of TV shows that create cult like followings like South Park, Family Guy, Battlestar Galactica. These TV viewers are primarily young males and enjoy watching shows such as South Park, Battlestar Galactica, and Family Guy. Advertisers should consider airing commercials during these shows and other media channels (movies, websites) with an irreverent sense of humor.
Consumers who likely enjoy television shows like Gilmore Girls, Lipstick Jungle, and Dancing With The Stars. They can be targeted with advertisements during these shows and similar programming.
Users who are identified as likely to have watched the Grammy's on television in the past and plan to watch it next year. They can be reached in advertisements aired during the program.

Users who are identified as likely to enjoy watching television shows like The Colbert Report, Breaking Bad, Pawn Stars, and others geared toward a masculine demographic. They can be reached on networks that air these shows and through other masculine-dominated media sources, as well as streaming programs and websites like Netflix or Hulu.

Users who are identified as likely to spend at least five hours per week watching HBO. Marketers looking to reach this segment should consider advertising on HBO or partnering with them to produce co-branded content.

Consumers who are likely to be big fans of Oprah, including her television show and magazine and interact with her brand at least once a week. They can be reached by advertisements placed in both of these media outlets. Additionally, marketers can consider encouraging Oprah to speak about their product or give it out in one of her famous giveaways to the audience.
Consumers primarily watch television to stay up-to-date on the latest news. They can be targeted through advertising on news programs.
Consumers who love watching "how-to" instruction television shows. They can be targeted during the airing of these shows, and with co-branded content that encourages hobbies and crafts.

Users who are identified as likely to watch horror movies

Users who are identified as likely to enjoy watching foreign films and movies in other languages. They can be reached at foreign film showings/festivals and on websites like Netflix that stream foreign films.

Users who are identified as likely to enjoy watching drama movies. They can be reached at movie theaters where dramatic movies are being shown and on websites that stream movies. They can also likely be reached during dramatic television shows (see "Couch Potatoes? Drama Lovers.)

Users who are identified as likely to enjoy watching family friendly movies. They likely have children in the household and thus can be targeted for products such as toys and clothing that may appeal to their children as well.

Consumers who are likely to have been to a movie at least four times in the past 30 days. They are highly likely to view newly released movies, so marketers can reach them in advertisements at movie screenings, as well as in publications and websites that publish movie showing times and reviews. Additionally, marketers may be interested in reaching this segment through product placement in newly produced blockbuster movies.

Consumers are likely to have seen either a comedy or a romantic comedy and are interested in other comedic and romantic media sources, like television shows or magazines, and can be targeted through these channels

Users who are identified as likely to be Retail shoppers

Users who are identified as likely to be a "Just the Essentials" shopper. Based on the statistical analysis of consumers that have reported to primarily purchase necessities; they know what they want before they go shopping and are not impulsive Shopper. Key Themes: no nonsense.

Users who are identified as likely to be a" Status Strivers" shopper. Based on the statistical analysis of consumers that report shopping is fun and recreational; they like to browse as much as buy; willing to travel to stores and spend the money and time necessary to keep up with trends. Key Theme: image.

Users who are identified as likely to be a "Mall Maniacs" shopper. Based on the statistical analysis of consumers that have reported they are ?try- sumers?; they like to try new products, stores and styles; connect and interact with preferred brands; shopping brings enjoyment to them. Key Themes: attention, approval, quality and image.

Users who are identified as likely to be a ?Upscale Clicks and Bricks? shopper. Based on the statistical analysis of consumers that have reported to be knowledgeable and buy in-store or online; always carefully research purchases online first, shop around and compare prices before buying. Key Theme: good deals.

Users who are identified as likely to be a "Virtual Shopper" shopper. Based on the statistical analysis of consumers that have reported to go for the bargains and the Internet helps them find discounts so they don?t pay full price. Key Themes: affordability and ease.

Users who are identified as likely to be a "Original Traditionalists" shopper. Based on the statistical analysis of consumers that have reported that they are loyal to their brands, stores, services, and their country; knowledgeable and the most environmentally responsible group who incorporate green practices on a regular basis. Key Themes: experience, trust, and reliability.
